        public static Board getBoard()
        The getBoard function is a static function that returns the current instance of the Board class. If there is no current instance, it creates one and then returns it.

      • enoughSpace

        public boolean enoughSpace(Word word)
        The enoughSpace function checks to see if the word can be placed on the board. It does this by checking if there is enough space for it to fit in either a vertical or horizontal direction.
        Parameters:
        word - Check if the word does not exceed the limits of the board
        Returns:
        True if the word can be placed on the board

      • checkCorners

        public boolean checkCorners(Word word)
        The checkCorners function checks to see if the word is placed on the board in a legal manner. It does this by checking to see if there are any tiles adjacent to it, and returns true or false accordingly.
        Parameters:
        word - Pass the word object to be checked
        Returns:
        True if the there are other words or tiles in the corners of the given word

      • isNear

        public boolean isNear(Word word)
        The isNear function checks to see if the word is near another word or tile in all directions, uses other functions to check all sides.
        Parameters:
        word - to be checked for valid placement
        Returns:
        True if the word is near this word

      • boardLegal

        public boolean boardLegal(Word word)
        The boardLegal function checks if the word can be legally placed on the board. It checks if there is enough space for it, and that it overlaps with an existing tile or not. If it does overlap, then we check that no switching of tiles was needed in order to fit the word. In addition, it checks if this is the first word in the board.
        Parameters:
        word - Check if the word placement is legal
        Returns:
        True if the word is legal on the board, and false otherwise

      • dictionaryLegal

        public boolean dictionaryLegal(Word word)
        The dictionaryLegal function checks to see if the word is in the dictionary.
        Parameters:
        word - Pass the word to be checked into the function
        Returns:
        True if the word is in the dictionary, and false otherwise

      • getWords

        public java.util.ArrayList<Word> getWords(Word word)
        The getWords function takes a Word object as an argument and returns an ArrayList of Word objects. The function first adds the word passed to it as an argument to the ArrayList that will be returned. Then, it checks around each letter in the word for new words created by placing that letter on a blank space on the board. If there are any new words created, they are added to this list of Words and returned at completion of this function call. If no new words were created by placing one or more letters from word onto blank spaces on our board (
        Parameters:
        word - Get the row, col, and tiles of the word to be placed on the board
        Returns:
        A list of words that are created by placing the given word on the board

        public boolean isRed(int i,

        The isRed function checks if the square on in given coordinates red.
        Parameters:
        i - Represent the row number of the board
        j - Represent the column number of the board
        Returns:
        True if the square at row i and column j is red

      • getScore

        public int getScore(Word word)
        The getScore function calculates the score of a word. The score is calculated for the given word and considers the words that are created by placing this word on the board.
        Parameters:
        word - Get the row and column of the first letter in the word in and all the ist letters and scoring information.
        Returns:
        The score of the word according to the rules

      • tryPlaceWord

        public int tryPlaceWord(Word word)
        The tryPlaceWord function checks if a word can be placed on the board. It first checks if the word is dictionary legal, then it checks if it's board legal. If both are true, we check if all created words are dictionary legal, if so, we add their score to our total score. We return 0 in case of an error or illegal move, otherwise we return our total score (including new created words).
        Parameters:
        word - Check if the word is legal on the board
        Returns:
        The score for the word if it can be placed,
